newsitem.title: USA: Wilshire revises Q1 eps to $0.01/shr.
newsitem.headline: Wilshire revises Q1 eps to $0.01/shr.

text.p: Wilshire Financial Services Group Inc amended its first quarter net income to $63,000 or $0.01 per share compared to previously reported earnings of $3.1 million or $0.41 per share.
Stockholders' equity and total assets are $61.2 million and $1,095.0 million compared to previously reported amounts of $64.2 million and $1,098.1 million, respectively.

Wilshire restated its earnings to reflect the reversal of servicing fee revenue of about $5.6 million and to defer its recognition over the life of the related loan and securities portfolios, expected to be approximately 18 months.
Arthur Andersen, Wilshire's independent accountants, recommended that the revenue received be deferred and amortized over the life of the related portfolios.

This restatement defers revenue recognition, but does not impact the economics of the transaction or affect the receipt of the amount. Due to reversal of servicing fee revenue and reduction of the cost basis in the related portfolios, such amount will be recognized over the life of the related portfolios, expected to be about 18 months, in the form of increased interest income.
